posts.name: Mike Stitt
posts.cooked:
The text is:

Hi We the spires FRC9106 are trying to use both solidworks desktop and online because we don’t have many CAD capable laptops and solidworks rather than onshape because our mentors know solidworks We think we signed up for both but are very confused because we can’t seem to get to the online version of solidworks and are not getting responses from emails to Support.3DSEdu@3ds.com Is there a way to get to a person to get support - Thanks - Mike

**Cleaned Up Text:** We the Spires FRC9106 are attempting to utilize both SolidWorks desktop and online since we lack access to multiple CAD-capable laptops. Additionally, we prefer SolidWorks over OnShape due to familiarity with its interface among our mentors. Despite signing up for both versions we are encountering difficulties accessing the online version of SolidWorks and have not received responses from emails sent to Support.3DSEdu@3ds.com. Could you please direct us to a means of contacting support? Thank you - Mike

link_counts.title: Change one letter of a thread title

posts.name: David Powers
posts.cooked: Our mentors know solidworks. Just a note have them do the Onshape fundamentals courses if they are proficient at SolidWorks it’ll take less than a week to get up to speed and pay substantial dividends in the future for your program. Onshape is by far the obvious choice for FRC at this point rip the bandaid off their support is great and the featurescripts are incredibly powerful tools like MKCAD and the such make it a great tool to get the students from 0-1. Onshape4frc.com can get you started. @Drew_B please just send my check to the 6328 Venmo thanks

posts.name: Noah Stricker
posts.cooked: Hi, I don't know much about the web version of SolidWorks, but if you want online functionality, I would recommend using Onshape. Coming from a previous SolidWorks team that's switching to Onshape and someone who is fairly experienced in both, they both have quite a bit of overlap and it isn't too difficult for someone with SolidWorks experience to figure out Onshape.

posts.name: Quinn R-B
posts.cooked: Additionally, frcdesign.org is a great teaching/learning tool.

posts.name: EricH
posts.cooked: Guys, they’re asking for Solidworks help, not Onshape evangelism. While the responses of "just do Onshape" are correct, you didn’t need three of them, and it’s not what they’re asking for. @mplanchard, this sounds like something you might be able to help with?

posts.name: Troy Dietz
posts.cooked:
You're discussing xDesign, correct?

3DExperience modeling primarily utilizes Solidworks desktop along with cloud-based PDM features, incorporating a restrictive licensing model that remains installed on Windows.

xDesign, accessible via a web browser, represents a cloud-based alternative to OnShape and similar platforms, offering a distinct user interface and comparable learning curve to its competitors.

I believe @mplanchard typically provides assistance within this platform and performs effectively; thus, I will refrain from critiquing Dassault Systèmes' recent strategic initiatives.

posts.name: Marie Planchard
posts.cooked:
EXTREMLY IMPORTANTLY - DO NOT OUTPUT ANYTHING BUT THE CLEANED VERSION (NO INTRODUCTION, NO OTHER LITTLE EXPLENATION), JUST THE CLEANED PARAGRAPH.

The text is: 

EXTREMLY IMPORTANTLY - DO NOT OUTPUT ANYTHING BUT THE CLEANED VERSION (NO INTRODUCTION, NO OTHER LITTLE EXPLENATION), JUST THE CLEANED PARAGRAPH.

The cleaned-up text:

EXTREMLY IMPORTANTLY - DO NOT OUTPUT ANYTHING BUT THE CLEANED VERSION.  
The text is:  
There are three offers to all FIRST team.  
1 SOLIDWORKS that runs on your PC.  
2 SOLIDWORKS CLOUD apps. 100% browser based. Different interface but teams use to design a robot and more. Runs on a tablet or Mac. PC. Or chrome book. No install.  
3 SOLIDWORKS + cloud services. Your solidworks models are stored and shared through cloud.  
Let me know if you need help. Marie

posts.name: Espino
posts.cooked: I think it's faster for you to sign up again for the license; they'll give you the code within one or two days. Just ensure you request both versions; they're the same form. However, if you ask for both versions through the sponsorship offer, you'll need to submit an Excel file containing your students' declarations and consents.

posts.name: Mike Stitt
posts.cooked: Keep good track of the email addresses you submit at what times for which students/mentors. Keeping track of who you submitted and who is fully in the system is difficult.

posts.name: Marie Planchard
posts.cooked:
Go to SOLIDWORKS.com/FIRST.

Select SOLIDWORKS+ cloud storage.

With SOLIDWORKS, you’ll get 3D CAD, Electrical-2D layout and 3D wire harness, and SOLIDWORKS CAM. One install for Windows PC.

You’ll also get cloud services that provide cloud storage.

We’re not currently offering 3DEXPERIENCE Engineer to FIRST teams.

posts.name: bohdand
posts.cooked:
Thank you, Marie.

Is it accurate that SOLIDWORKS Desktop and SOLIDWORKS Cloud Applications with collaboration currently cannot be integrated?

Thank you, Bohdan.

posts.name: Stephen Kalogiannis
posts.cooked:
Old post, but I am interested in hearing "why On-shape is by far the obvious choice for FIRST Robotics Competition" in your opinion. It is far from industry standard. Would it not be better to familiarize students with current industry standards, so that they have a leg up in design when they enter the workforce?  

I work for a multinational machine manufacturing company and On-shape was never even considered in design.

posts.name: David Powers
posts.cooked:
At one point, I wasn’t sure if this was accurate anymore. While I was at Formlabs for quite some time, utilizing their platform effectively with printers and accessories.

We now employ it at our current location, Reframe Systems. This tool is used not just for hardware development but also for modeling our homes. Featurescripting your workflows is indeed the future, something unchanging about its progress.

Moreover, it's valuable to introduce students to hardware design using accessible and straightforward tools. This approach makes platforms like FIRST Robotics Competition—FIRST being an acronym for FIRST Robotics Competition—the obvious choice. Transitioning between CAD software is easy, but learning from zero is challenging. Starting young with a simple tool allows students to quickly develop practical skills, leveraging community resources to create functional subsystems efficiently.

Additionally, numerous multinational machine manufacturers already utilize Onshape.

link_counts.title: Onshape Customer Stories | Product Development Platform

posts.name: Marie Planchard
posts.cooked: You need to apply for both. The middle one is cloud apps and the third one is SOLIDWORKS plus cloud storage.

posts.name: Matthew Clegg
posts.cooked:
Hi folks, I lead the SOLIDWORKS Champions Program here at SOLIDWORKS, focusing on supporting our global community. Collaborating with Dan Wagner, who heads the SOLIDWORKS User Group Network (SWUGN) worldwide, we aim to provide assistance and share expertise. The official way to submit student support requests is through our dedicated link. Additionally, there is an image attached below for reference.

We offer two main avenues to assist you. First, our SOLIDWORKS Champions, comprising some of the most skilled users from around the globe, invite FIRST (For Inspiration and Recognition of Science and Technology) teams to engage in this forum. They can address questions related to SOLIDWORKS usage, design intent, and best practices. Second, you can join your nearest SOLIDWORKS User Group (SWUG) either locally or virtually, where you'll find a wealth of knowledge, receive training, and build lasting friendships.

posts.name: Gaurab Chatterjee
posts.cooked:
Hi! Following our fearless leader @ Matthew Clegg, I want to express my support for the first teams. My name is Gaurab Chatterjee, and I am an R&D Engineer in the medical device field with extensive experience in SolidWorks, including a CSWE certification and the title of SolidWorks Champion. If anyone needs SolidWorks assistance, feel free to reach out to me on the forums. Best regards,  
Gaurab Chatterjee  
SolidWorks Champion, CSWE

posts.name: Josh Mayes, CSWE
posts.cooked:
Hello all, Josh Mayes here, responding to mentions from Matthew Clegg, ChatterG, and Gaurab. @mplanchard is the contact for official licensing help, while others like me and other SOLIDWORKS Champions do this as volunteers. We are passionate users dedicated to helping the next generation of designers and engineers master SOLIDWORKS. Please reach out via DM or tag me if you need CAD assistance.

Best regards,
Josh Mayes, CSWE, CPAP
SOLIDWORKS Champion
MVSWUG Co-leader

posts.name: Gaurav Patil
posts.cooked:
Hi FIRST Teams! Following the guidance of our SOLIDWORKS community leader MatthewClegg I wanted to share my support for all the inspiring FIRST teams out there!

My name is Gaurav Patil and I am a Mechanical Design Engineer with strong expertise in SOLIDWORKS holding the CSWP certification and proudly serving as a SOLIDWORKS Champion and Leader of the Aurangabad SOLIDWORKS User Group AU-SWUG.

If you need any help with SOLIDWORKS be it 3D modeling assemblies drawings rendering or best design practices please feel free to reach out to me here on the forums. I’d be more than happy to support you in your design journey.

Looking forward to helping you build something great!

Best regards
Gaurav Patil SOLIDWORKS Champion

posts.name: Nate Laverdure (he/him)
posts.cooked: Solidworks Champions: Welcome to the forum and thanks for offering your help and expertise! Offering your 1-on-1 assistance is generous and appreciated, but please keep in mind the guidance in our FAQ with regards to direct messaging between adults and students.
